thread.title: Report: Mason Miller (finger) to be placed on IL
thread.title_full: Report: Mason Miller (finger) to be placed on IL

author: Alex Hunter
title: Report: Mason Miller (finger) to be placed on IL
text:
Oakland closer Mason Miller will be placed on the injured list with a broken left pinky finger, which he suffered after “put his hand down awkwardly on the training table while getting ready to do an exercise,” per the MLB.com’s Martin Gallegos.
Important clarification on Mason Miller injury: he did not pound the table out of frustration. He put his hand down awkwardly on the training table while getting ready to do an exercise.— Martín Gallegos (@MartinJGallegos)
 [July 25, 2024]
Miller has been one of the best closers in baseball this season, posting a 2.21 ERA while logging 15 and 70 strikeouts over 40 2/3 innings.
The 25-year-old was named to his first All-Star team this season. During that contest, Miller pitched a hitless frame and recorded the fastest pitch in MLB All-Star game history, with one of his fastballs coming in at 103.4 MPH.
Mason Miller Masterclass.— Oakland A's (@Athletics)
[pic.twitter.com/LxRKtfWpvO] [July 17, 2024]
With MLB’s July 30 trade deadline fast-approaching and the Athletics sitting dead last in the AL West, Miller’s name has been thrown around in trade rumors recently. There’s still a chance he gets dealt by the deadline despite the injury, given this aliment is to his non-throwing hand.
Currently, there is no timeline for Miller’s return.
